Seven Deadly Sins The Seven Deadly Sins are sins that characterize fallen humanity, so classified by traditional orthodox Christianity and especially held to, and taught by, the Roman Catholic Church since the early Middle Ages.

The seven deadly sins are also known as cardinal sins, or capital vices. These delightful characteristics are of Christian origin and concern the grouping of certain behaviours that have immorality as their bedfellow. They are: pride, greed, lust, envy, gluttony, wrath and sloth.
